items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.58mAOD at 16:15 on 07/10/21 and 4.61mAOD at 04:45 on 08/10/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are rising. The river flow at Teddington Weir is normal for this time of year at 93 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain normal for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 09:30 on 08/10/21, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at 12:15 AM on 07/10/2021.
Areas most at risk include Coast at North Morecambe Bay from Roosebeck to Carnforth including low lying areas around Ulverston, Greenodd, Haverthwaite, Flookburgh, Grange-over-Sands, Levens, Milnthorpe, Sandside, Arnside and Silverdale.
Highest tide level is at 12:15 AM on 07/10/2021. Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of this time.
Weather conditions are expected to produce large onshore waves.
We are expecting higher than normal tides over the next 3 days and as a result we may issue further alerts or warnings.
We will continue to monitor the forecast. 
Plan driving routes to avoid coastal roads, which may be flooded.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 07/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: Levels remain high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck, Derwentwater and surrounding watercourses. Flooding is likely to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwentwater. This Flood Alert is likely to remain in place for several days. A Flood Warning is also in place for Keswick Campsite. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 PM on 07/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message: Water levels are high on Windermere, Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel due to several days of heavy rain. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 07/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

Over the last few days we have seen several bands of heavy rainfall in the River Roding catchment. This has meant that levels in the Roding have risen.

River levels are now beginning to fall, but are expected to remain high overnight on Wednesday 6th October. Flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river may continue to affect the areas of Abridge, Loughton and Buckhurst Hill. Flooding from surface water may also remain.

We expect the river levels to continue to slowly fall over the coming days.  No further significant rain is forecast over the next few days.

Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

We are continuing to monitor river levels and have staff in the field checking for and clearing blockages.

This message will be updated by 10am on Thursday 7 October or earlier if the situation changes.

The River Arun at Pulborough is still high following a very wet start to October, but looks to have now approached its peak. Water will be extensive through fields, and could affect gardens and approach properties on Lower Street and Swan Corner, Pulborough, near to Swan Bridge and Bridge Cottages, Greatham. At 14:30 on Thursday (07/10/2021), the river at Houghton Bridge, Amberley will peak at a similar height to that seen on Wednesday lunchtime (06/10/2021), with water close to the tops of the banks. Flooding is not currently expected this week in Arundel or Ford. Very little rain is forecast for the next 5 days. River levels at Pulborough should begin to slowly fall from 16:00 today (07/10/2021), but flows will not reduce significantly until next week. Please keep flood protection products in place, if you have them. Our pumps in Pulborough are running to help reduce the risk of flooding. We will update this message by 20:00 on 07/10/2021.

Property flooding is not expected.  High tide is expected at Trowlock Island at 4:30pm this afternoon (07/10/21). The river may over top banks and flood low lying land and footpaths. The predicted height of the tide is 4.85 - 5.05 metres. Both previous high tides were slightly higher than forecast, with the high tide this morning reaching just above flood alert level (5.07 metres).  Therefore we will continue to closely monitor the forecast and tide heights. This message will be updated this evening (07/10/21).

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
    
We continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: The Essex coast from Clacton to and including, St Peters Flat and the Colne and Blackwater estuaries
items.message: Levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. The period of high spring tides continues for the next few days, and further alerts may be issued.  We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Clyst has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. No further rainfall is forecast for the next 48 hours.
We are continuing to monitor the situation.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: East Sussex, Kent, Surrey, West Sussex

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  No further significant rainfall is currently forecast for over the next few days. We will continue to monitor the situation.

The River Adur is high, but is now slowly falling, following Tuesday morning's heavy rain. Minor flood impacts will ease, but some water will remain in fields, rural roads and gardens including properties near Mock Bridge near Shermanbury and the A281 at Mock Bridge. Very little rain is forecast for the remainder of the week. The river should continue to fall throughout Wednesday, returning to near normal Thursday afternoon (07/10/2021). Please continue to take care if driving on routes vulnerable to flooding, residual water could remain for a number of days. We will reissue this message if the risk of flooding returns.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: The Western Rother is still high through Fittleworth following Tuesday morning's heavy rain, but it is now slowly falling. Minor flood impacts will continue to affect fields, rural roads and gardens near Fittleworth Mill, Fittleworth. Very little rain is forecast in the next 5 days, which will enable river levels to fall further. However, normal flows will not return to Fittleworth until the weekend. River levels between Liss and Midhurst and at Lodsbridge near Selham are already near normal. Please keep flood protection measures in place in Fittleworth while residual flood impacts remain. We will continue to monitor the levels and forecast and reissue this message if the risk of property flooding increases.

items.message: The risk of flooding from the Cripsey Brook has now reduced and levels have fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

items.description: River Anker at Mancetter, Witherley and Atherstone

items.message: The River Ouse near Barcombe is still high but is now falling slowly, following Tuesday morning's heavy rain. Minor flood impacts will ease, but some water will remain in fields, gardens and on rural roads, including Barcombe Mills road, Fletching Mill Bridge and at Sharpsbridge. Very little rain is forecast for the rest of the week. The river will continue to fall, possibly returning to near normal at Barcombe by Wednesday evening (06/10/2021). River levels near Ardingly, Lindfield and on Sloop Lane have already returned to near normal. Please continue to take care if driving on routes vulnerable to flooding as residual water could remain for a couple of days. We continue to operate our structures at Pimms Lock and Barcombe to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will reissue this message if the risk of flooding returns.

items.description: Somerset coast at Dunster Beaches, Blue Anchor, Steart, Stolford and Brean
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
    
We continue to monitor the situation.

The River Arun is still high between Newbridge near Billingshurst and Pallingham Quay, but is now slowly falling. Minor flood impacts will continue to affect fields, gardens and rural roads in these areas. Very little rain is forecast in the next 5 days, which will enable river levels to fall further. However, normal flows will not return to Pallingham Quay until Sunday (10/10/2021). River levels through Horsham and Broadbridge Heath are already near normal. Please keep flood protection products in place at Newbridge and Pallingham Quay while residual flood impacts remain. We will continue to monitor the levels and forecast and reissue this message if the risk of property flooding increases.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: River Trent from Cromwell Weir to Gainsborough
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River and high tide levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are patrolling watercourses in the area.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.

items.message: This Flood Alert has been removed as levels have fallen below levels of concern. No significant rainfall is forecast over the next few days. We are monitoring the forecast and will re-issue this alert if necessary.

This flood alert has been removed as river levels have fallen below the level of concern. Flood alerts and warnings remain in force elsewhere in the catchment following heavy overnight rainfall. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and avoid any unnecessary danger.

The level of Derwentwater is high following several days of rain. Areas most at risk of flooding include low lying land bordering the shores of Derwentwater and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses, do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This Flood Warning is expected to remain in place for several days. We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this warning if necessary. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 07/10/2021, or as the situation changes.
